title: Ticket #7181: Account Group documentation needs help.
description:
This section of the manual is in dire need of assistance:

  1. The text 
    Much of the reason that the previous method for defining accounting groups
is no longer recommended is that the name of an accounting is that it used
the period (.) character to separate the group name from the user name.
    gives me a stroke.
  2. If we don't recommend the first method for specifying accounting information, why do we even mention it? If we need to mention it for backwards-compability, at least mention it second and say that's why we're mentioning it.
  3. Jaime and I aren't sure the whole "not recommended" thing is actually true (anymore) anyway.
  4. And even if it were, it's not at all obvious why the + syntax actually helps the problem; wouldn't +AccountingGrop = "group_physics.todd.miller" break things just as badly as specifying it in two different attributes? If the answer is some filter in condor_submit, and we recommend bypassing it, shouldn't we just remove the filter?
remarks:
2019-Oct-14 15:44:16 by gthain:
I've removed most of the extremely incorrect documentation. This section still needs work, but it is better than before.
